panels.description:
Graph based on pg_wait_sampling_profile view of https://github.com/postgrespro/pg_wait_sampling extension.

On vertical Axis is number of backends with specific wait event type  

- Client and Activity events are not shown by default, but can be done visible by clicking on them in the legend list.
- CPU or Uncategorised wait event means backend either is being executed on CPU or waiting for CPU or some other wait that is not known yet
panels.title: Active session history (ASH)

panels.description:
This measures the mean duration for each read operation (including time spent in the I/O queue, not just time from Dispatch to Compete).

Good latency should be a few milliseconds; if the graph's scale is in seconds, you have a problem!

High read latency and deep I/O queues often occur together.  They can be caused by either increased service time from the block device (slower physical I/O) or increased demand (request arrival rate).  Note that writes can sometimes stall reads.
panels.title: Disk Read Latency - Mean Duration per Read Op

panels.description:
This measures the mean duration for each read operation (including time spent in the I/O queue, not just time from Dispatch to Compete).

Good latency should be a few milliseconds; if the graph's scale is in seconds, you have a problem!

High read latency and deep I/O queues often occur together.  They can be caused by either increased service time from the block device (slower physical I/O) or increased demand (request arrival rate).  Note that writes can sometimes stall reads.
panels.title: Disk Write Latency - Mean Duration per Read Op

panels.description: This measures the mean count of read operations per wall-clock second from each mounted block device.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput (operations/sec)

panels.description: This measures the mean count of write operations per wall-clock second from each mounted block device.
panels.title: Disk Write Throughput (operations/sec)

targets.expr: sum by () (irate(pg_stat_database_xact_commit{env="$environment", fqdn="$fqdn"}[$__rate_interval]))/(sum by () (irate(pg_stat_database_xact_rollback{env="$environment", fqdn="$fqdn"}[$__rate_interval]))+sum by () (irate(pg_stat_database_xact_commit{env="$environment", fqdn="$fqdn"}[$__rate_interval])))
